mixed-citation.article-title: Revision of the genus Miridiba Reitter, 1902 (Coleoptera, Scarabaeidae, Melolonthinae): genital morphotypes and new taxonomic data

tp:treatment-sec.p: Miridiba furcillata Keith & Sabatinelli, 2010: 340 , figs 5–6 ( type loc.: Kathmandu valley, Nepal ).

Keith & Sabatinelli (2010) described Miridiba furcillata based on a series of 32 specimens , designating holotype , allotype and thirty paratypes . This species shows features of external morphology, which characterize Miridiba . Also, parameres with two dorsal and ventral branches separated from each other ( Keith & Sabatinelli 2010 : figs 5–6) characterize morphotype I “ Trichophora ”. Hence, this species is included in this genital morphotype.
